name: LHS 1140b
description:
The planet's inclination is 9.0. This is a typical value for a presumed planet of a main-sequence star,
but it is nevertheless considerably larger than the mass of the star implies. 
Certain exoplanets receivea small mass deduction, meaning that their mass is associated with that of another object or objects.
With the inclination of the "Verotas system", this deduction is reminiscent of that of "NN Serpentis". 
At the time of discovery, it had the longest orbital period of any directly imaged exoplanet.
